intro: Trophis philippinensis, commonly known as the Philippine trumpet vine, is a climbing plant native to the Philippines. It belongs to the family Bignoniaceae and is characterized by its distinctive trumpet-shaped flowers that are typically yellow or orange in color. The plant has opposite, heart-shaped leaves and produces long, slender pods that contain seeds. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates and is often found in moist, shaded areas of forests.
